MIR. and Mrs. Wilbert Flowers
and their son. Brandon, motored
to Texas for a two weeks vaca-
tion. They will visit their parents.


MIR. and Mrs. George Washing
ton and family will spend a few
weeks in Pontiac. Michigan. They
will be houseguests Of Mrs. Dor
othy Van Dyke.


Robin Green is visiting her
grandmother, Mrs. Florence
Green in Beaumont. Texas.


Mrs. Ida Mae Freeman, Of
Wichita Kansas, recently visited
her brothers Virgil and Luther
Berry.


Mrs. Irene Mcclure. of Leland.
Tex, is in the city visiting her
sister. Mrs. Betty Pitre.


This reporter is happy to see
the face lifting at our Elks Lodge
At. on 9TH Ave-, and 1t makes
the area look better.


Here's to them having grand
Pacific States Convention next
week.

NEW HAVEN, Conn. DR.. Mar
tin L. King, Jr.. received a
standing ovation Of 10000 per-
sons at Yale Universitys 263rd
commencement.


He received an honorary de-
gree of doctor of laws from the
university.


DR.. King, IS, was released
Saturday on 5000 bail from a
St. Augustine. Florida jail.


Twelve other pers ons received
honorary degrees.

full articles.headline:
NEGRO HISTORY NOTES
Samuel Ward
full articles.article:
Ward of the prominent Negroes of the
critical period of history from 1880 1867 Impressed with
superior gifts which gave early Gerrit
enabled him liberal education Ward then entered
upon ministry in the Presbyterian Church. For several
he ded white church South Butler New York. where
according William Wells Brown Ward preached with
agon Ward took the platform from 1910 the Of the
Fugitive Slave Law Of 1850 preached ecred in church.
hail. schoohous and central New York. standing
feet height voice. and energetic
gestures Ward says his bgraher Railways impressed

full articles.headline:
All Around


By FIoru Ruffin
full articles.article:
MIR. and Mrs. Wilbert Flowers
and their son. Brandon, motored
to Texas for a two weeks vaca-
tion. They will visit their parents.


MIR. and Mrs. George Washing
ton and family will spend a few
weeks in Pontiac. Michigan. They
will be houseguests Of Mrs. Dor
othy Van Dyke.


Robin Green is visiting her
grandmother, Mrs. Florence
Green in Beaumont. Texas.


Mrs. Ida Mae Freeman, Of
Wichita Kansas, recently visited
her brothers Virgil and Luther
Berry.


Mrs. Irene Mcclure. of Leland.
Tex, is in the city visiting her
sister. Mrs. Betty Pitre.


This reporter is happy to see
the face lifting at our Elks Lodge
At. on 9TH Ave-, and 1t makes
the area look better.


Here's to them having grand
Pacific States Convention next
week.
